title: The Solution to ELO Hell
body:
Stop basing LP gain and loss on whether you win or lose the game. If Superman does well every game and his team fails hard every time, why should Superman be penalized every single time? Because Riot doesn't hire real employees to think about these things, they'd rather post pictures of their food and talk about how awesome their lives are, gg.

At the very least, Superman should not incur an LP loss for doing well, this would allow for more reasonable opportunity and motivation for people to do well even in ELO hell.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=BlizzardMOBAsoon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6ulpEJk3,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-03-28T12:12:19.303+0000)

> Stop basing LP gain and loss on whether you win or lose the game. If Superman does well every game and his team fails hard every time, why should Superman be penalized every single time? Because Riot doesn't hire real employees to think about these things, they'd rather post pictures of their food and talk about how awesome their lives are, gg.
> 
> At the very least, Superman should not incur an LP loss for doing well, this would allow for more reasonable opportunity and motivation for people to do well even in ELO hell.

I do agree with this. Well, somewhat. The leagues thing is a terrible system. Basically the worst thing they could have implemented. Worse than anything i could have imagined they would implement for the ranked ladder. But, while i do think losing should cost you lp regardless of how you performed. On an occasion where you had an afk or someone that literally dies over 20 times in a game there should be an LP loss reduction failsafe. I think it's a good idea.

statistically, if you're better than everyone around you, the other team has a 5/9 chance of having a feeder/the worst person in the lobby, and your team has a 4/9 chance. this works out in practice as well, nearly every person who charts their KDA and objective taking versus their elo climb long term has shown that if they're doing better, they climb.

As for referring to someone as superman, its called the [Dunning-Kruger effect](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dunning%E2%80%93Kruger_effect). If you are in that elo, 1 of 3 things will happen. you're not good enough, and will lose consistently, and will drop. you're too good, and will rise because of the wonders of statistics (and carrying like a boss) or 3: you deserve to be there until you get better, but cannot see that you need to improve. thinking of yourself as superman blocks this, and makes you play the game like you're alone on an island. which consistently loses games because you're not working with your team. if you watch diamond+ games you can see that in soloQ they work together wonderfully with ganks, counterganks, split pushing, and objective taking. 

This is a team game and making it seem single player is a sure way to lose more games.

Yet you're making very big assumptions that just because one person does well, that your team will likely win, that is not true, and almost never true in fact. "Superman" was not me, it was an example, re-read for comprehension. Again, re-read for comprehension, it's to motivate people to play despite being in the lowest possible tiers, knowing that they can still advance despite the endless lazy playing and disconnects/AFKs/etc. You don't "deserve" to be in Bronze 5 if you continually do well and your team happens to feed their other lanes early on every time, you're making an irrational, completely biased statement that makes me question if you're even a real player at all. It earned the name "ELO HELL" because it is truly that **bad**, and no one player should be held back because of bad luck in getting grouped with teammates who feed/don't care/rage/AFK/disconnect.

People in high elo consistantly say that elo hell doesn't exist, because if you do well you teams WILL win more. the comments weren't directed at you, they were general comments on statistics and probability. the word you is simply more flowing than the third person singular 'they'. the points still stand. you will statistically get less feeders and bads on your team,  at the rate of 5/9 to 4/9. if EVERYONE is bad then your team is 1/5 better because you are better. (insert they for the yous here if they make they happier)
Statistically, the other team has a better chance of having a Diamond smurf.
The number of bad players is FAR higher than the number of diamond smurfs, high enough for them to be statistically invalid.
What sort of statistics did you run on that? Also, people say only very few people ACTUALLY troll....so you can use the same argument against yourself.
The thought included afk's and just bad feeders, which are going to be higher.

I am not sure why Lp Loss cant be reduced if you have a player with a score like 0/1/0 5 cs.
To me if a player goes to lane at the start gets killed and rage quits their team should get a lp loss discount.
IF you get a rage quit or a AFK you should get the LP loss reduced by 50%
I'd imagine that things like MMR and LP gain/loss could be influenced by your champion mastery rating once the mastery system is added, or something similar.

what you're suggesting...would....ohmy, make this Team based game,  a single player game.... Ohmy....why would you wish this upon us

It's not very.. uuh "team" based to me
considering everyone who is planning to climb the ladder is to be the 1 man army carrying 4 assumed deadweights

Bro bro bro. Elo hell isn't real. I got out of Bronze twice carrying a useless team. Bronze is literally a test to your carrying skills. If your team isn't helping you, catch people out. That'll encourage your team to fight after. If they see you doing well, they'll naturally want to listen to you because they want the freelo. It's up to you to win. Pick carry champs, like fiora, wuking, riven, ahri, vayne, syndra... Champs that can do well on their own.

I don't think there's an official team sport in the world that doesn't, officially or unofficially, use the Elo system to rank individual players. It's literally the most fair way of objectively judging players known to team sports.
Have you never heard of wrestling?
Isn't that an individual sport...?
Nope. A team wins a title. The Ohio State University won the NCAA team title this year.

I'm not sure what your point is. OP said there wasn't a sport that judge a player by something other than how their team does. I simply pointed out an example of why that is false.
Wrestling isn't a team sport, is his point. When the match up is 1 on 1, you don't really need a team ranking system.
Wrestling is a team sport. Period. I'm not sure why someone would even try to argue that?
There is no "elo hell"... it doesn't exist.
Please at the very least don't make it look like you are bot viewing and upvoting yourself every time D:

I'm flattered that you follow me around from thread to thread just to bot downvote and accuse me of bot upvoting. It's sad though that you're that bored, or that desperate, to do Riot's dirty trolling.
